newsitem.title: USA: Keycorp backs Q2, year estimates.
newsitem.headline: Keycorp backs Q2, year estimates.

text.p: KeyCorp said Thursday it backed earnings estimates of $1.00-$1.01 a share for the second quarter and $4.19 for the full year.

"We're comfortable at $1.00, $1.01 (a share for the second quarter)," Henry Meyer III, vice chairman and chief operating officer, said after a presentation at the Piper Jaffray investors conference here.
For 1997, "we're comfortable with analysts' expectations of $4.19," he said.
In the year-ago second quarter KeyCorp earned $0.92 a share. In all of 1996 it earned $3.71 a share.

Meyer said the earnings projection for the 1997 full year reflects a "ramp-up" of results for the second half. This would be due to securitization of student loans and reduced overhead expenses as a result of a planned sale of bank branches.
